intro: Noronhia cernua, commonly known as the drooping noronhia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Noronhia cernua is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and hanging baskets due to its ornamental flowers and compact size.
